p: From the literature, we obtained the age- and sex-specific probabilities of transitioning from salmonellosis to ReA or PI-IBS or of being hospitalized for severe salmonellosis and the probability of dying or returning to health from these states (see Table 2). Batz et al. ( 2014) estimated that 1.9% of cases of salmonellosis required hospitalization, from which 0.04% of individuals died and 99.96% recovered. We could not identify reliable data for the age- or sex-specific proportions of hospitalized salmonellosis cases or cases that resulted in death, although we acknowledge that these differences likely exist, and as such, these figures from Batz et al. ( 2014) were applied for all ages and across both sexes.
